Checking updates
Checking updates is an essential step before their installation, which may include the following steps:
checking the completeness of the update
to exclude conflicts and compatibility issues between applications;
checking the update content
for the presence of prohibited data, such as in compliance with security requirements.
The permission to check updates is available if at least one of the following
permissions
is granted:
"Check updates" - without possibility to install them afterward;
"Install updates" - with possibility to install updates after checking.
Checking the completeness of the update
To check the completeness of the update, sequentially select the menu items:
"Administration" → "Updates" → "Install updates".
On the opened page, updates can be checked by selecting the corresponding tab:
Installation via CI/CD
;
Installation of Individual/Complex GUF Files
.
Checking for GUF
Checking the correctness of the prepared
.guf
file or an update package (multiple update files combined into a
.zip
archive) is performed on the "GUF Installation" tab.
The main part of this page is occupied by the update installation wizard. On the left side of the page there are:
information on the latest installed update, indicating:
date and time of the update;
the user who installed the update;
names of the installed file;
The status of the installation process.
To check for updates, click
, followed by selecting the file/update package on the user’s personal computer.
It is not allowed to transfer the object type and objects referring to this type in the same file (*.guf). In this case, first transfer the update of the object type and then objects
The file/update package will be checked automatically after selecting the file, as a result of which the System will display its contents in the form of a table. If errors occur, a list of errors will be displayed at the bottom of the workspace:
To quickly find the missing objects, download the error list by clicking
and
upload
them to the instance from which the update was being compiled.
Possible error correction options are given in
"Special features of installing updates"
.
The "Next" and "Done" buttons used to install the update are only available with
Install Updates permissions
.
Checking for the CI/CD updates
This method of receiving updates is used if there is a
configured connection
to the application that will deliver updates.
In this case, go to the "Installation from CI/CD" tab, which contains the following panels:
Available updates – packages that deliver updates published in the applications to which the connection is configured;
The composition of the updates – the contents of the selected update package;
Result of installing the update  – the status of the selected update after performing verification, installation, or publication actions.
As a check, the user can:
get a list of current update packages from applications with which connection is configured by clicking
;
To view the list of updates received via CI/CD, the user must have access rights to instances of the type "Update received through CI/CD" in addition to the "Check the updates" permission.
select the update package and view its update composition, as well as by clicking
to check the possibility of future installation.
As a result of the check, the update is assigned one of the statuses:
verification error – the result of the verification, in which the installation of the update is not allowed. This result is accompanied by a corresponding notification and the new "Installation errors" tab, where a list of errors is presented:
Errors are eliminated on the instance where the update was received (for example, the development and testing instances)
.
checked – the result of the check, at which the update can be installed.
The update install button is only available with the
installing updates permissions
.
Checking the update content
To check the update file contents, follow these steps:
Sequentially select the menu items:
Administration → Updates → Check update
.
In the opened registry "Result of the update check against information security requirements", create an entry by clicking the
button in the control panel (for more details see
working with registries
).
On the opened page, in the "Update file" field, click the "Attach a file" button, which will open a modal window to upload the update file from your personal computer.
After adding the file, save the object by clicking the
button.
After saving the object, the "Comparison result in excel" field will display the check results in the *.xlsx format. The file can be exported by clicking the
button.
The control panel will display the available actions:
"Check" – viewing the results of checks based on regular expressions:
The export of the check results file in the *.xlsx format is done by clicking the
button.
The list of checks is defined by the reference guide of the "Regular expressions for update check" [SYS_ISS_REGEXP_ITEM] type.
To add a check, navigate to the registry type and create an entry by clicking the
button, then specify the required configuration parameters.
Data in the update file can be checked using one of the following methods:
using a
regular expression
specified in the corresponding field to search for text patterns that match the specified format;
using an SQL query specified in the "Query for extracting forbidden words" field to retrieve data from the database.
If both parameters are specified, the priority will be given to retrieving data using the regular expression.
"Generate checklist" – generating a list of objects of the specified types, as well as all permissions for the objects contained in the update file.
The "Checking objects" section displays a list of objects that belong to the types added to the reference guide "Object types included in the information security checklist" [SYS_ISS_CHECKLIST_TYPE].
The "Checking permissions for objects" section contains all permissions included in the update file, indicating the security principal and a privilege set.
The export of the check results file in the *.xlsx format is done by clicking the
button.
